title: Stoke Gabriel Walk Route

nearby.description: Torcross to Beesands and Start Point

images.title: Graham Taylor / Stoke Gabriel
images.caption: The millpool and church on a fine spring day.

images.title: Derek Harper / Cottages in Stoke Gabriel
images.caption: Cottages in Stoke Gabriel. These cottages are at the foot of Mill Hill close to the Mill Pool.

images.title: Graham Taylor / Stoke Gabriel
images.caption: Stoke Gabriel. The Harbour and creek at Stoke Gabriel.

images.title: Derek Harper / Pontoon, Stoke Gabriel
images.caption: Pontoon, Stoke Gabriel. Looking down the pontoon with its moored boats from the edge of the dam that retains the mill pool. Beyond, the creek emerges into the main estuary of the River Dart, with fields below East Cornworthy on the far side.

images.title: Paula Goodfellow / St. Mary and St. Gabriel Church in Stoke Gabriel
images.caption: St. Mary and St. Gabriel Church in Stoke Gabriel. 13th Century Tower and 15th Century Tower - to the right of this photo is the mill pond, and then the River Dart.

images.title: Paul Hutchinson / The weir at Stoke Gabriel
images.caption: The weir at Stoke Gabriel. To the left - the mill pond, to the right - the tidal River Dart. The photo was taken during the spring of 2007.

images.title: Derek Harper / Aish
images.caption: Aish. The cul-de-sac from Aish Cross turns a corner by Bowhay Farm.

images.title: Richard Knights / The riverside at Totnes
images.caption: The riverside at Totnes. Totnes now supports a lot of water based small industrial units beside the river Dart. It was near here that the ill fated catamaran of Team Phillips was built and launched in 2000. The picture is looking up river towards Totnes.

description: This picturesque village in Devon is a popular spot for tourists with its attractive mill pond, weir, old church, pretty cottages and views of the River Dart. You can stroll down to the quay, visit the mill pond and then go to see the 800 year old yew tree in the churchyard. There's also a charming pub dating back hundreds of years and winding streets with classic old Devon houses to see. This walk takes you from the village to nearby Totnes . On the way there's nice country views and a visit to the River Dart. The walk starts at the public car park next to the mill pool in the village. From here you follow country lanes through the village and the countryside to Aish. You then head west to Fleet Mill before turning north west to enter Totnes. The walk passes through the town before finishing by the river.
